item.content:encoded:
Eyelash extensions may be the most exciting beauty enhancement to hit the marketplace in generations, but there’s no doubt that they’re not for the faint of heart. In fact, any woman considering extensions should probably have a firm understanding of exactly what she’s hoping to achieve. After all, lash extensions can come in a variety of forms, and accomplish a number of different beauty goals – from simplifying your beauty regimen to creating a dramatic lash look that’s impossible to hide. Before choosing your lash style, here are just a few of the things you should consider.

How Dramatic is Too Dramatic?

One of the best things about eyelash extensions is that they can help you create so many different lash styles. Of course, some women go all-out with their lashes, and opt for the most dramatic look possible. They want long, thick, movie star lashes with that perfect curl their natural lashes could never achieve. Other women want a more understated look – perfect lashes that provide that everyday beauty aesthetic and a change that only their closest friends and family are likely to notice.

Before you choose, it’s important to consider just how dramatic you want your lash change to be. Are you looking for a truly glamorous look fit for a special event like a wedding? Or are you just looking for a way to achieve perfect lashes without going through the hassle of applying mascara and using a lash curler? To get your lashes just right, you’ll need to make that decision and discuss it with your lash artist before your application.

What Style Best Fits Your Eyes?

You’ll also need to consider your eyes’ shape, and the shape of your brow, if you want to pick the perfect lash style for your face. For example, if you have a thick brow bone and deep-set eyes, you can generally get away with longer, more voluminous lashes than normal. Round eyes tend to do extremely well with a cat’s eye style that has added volume at the outside edges of the eye. If your eyes are already your most prominent feature, you may want to try a style using varying lash lengths to provide a natural – but still stunning – lash look.

How Much Maintenance Can You Tolerate?

Of course, maintenance is also a factor. Some of the most dramatic looks may require more ongoing maintenance than you’re willing to endure, so you should think about that as well. How often do you want to commit to refills?

As you can see, there are a lot of things to consider when you’re choosing your own lash style. That’s why it’s so important to consult with the lash artists at Ebenezer Eyelash to ensure that your choice is the best one for your unique lifestyle and beauty needs. With proper consultation and the best eyelash extension services in New York City, you can rest assured that your style will always keep you looking and feeling your best. item.content:encoded:
While lash extensions continue to be one of the hottest beauty crazes on the planet today, far too many women never bother to take the time to learn how to properly care for them. Many extension-wearers fail to follow through on their aftercare responsibilities, and that often leads to problems down the road. Some are left to lament as the extensions fall our prematurely. Others end up with tangled or broken extensions. In almost every instance, problems could have been easily avoided had those women committed to proper aftercare. And one of the most important elements of that aftercare is daily lash brushing.

Of course, there are good reasons why you should never forget to brush your lashes and extensions. For that matter, you should be brushing your lashes daily even if you’re not wearing extensions – and for many of the same reasons that you brush the hair on your head. The fact is that hair – including the follicles that support your extensions – requires regular maintenance to remain at its cleanest and healthiest best. Need more reasons to always remember your daily lash brushing? Try these:

  • When you brush your extensions, you can help to remove any dust, pollen, oils, or eye makeup that may accumulate on the lashes throughout the day. Brushing dislodges those particles more effectively than your daily wash and rinse, preventing buildup over time.
  • Daily brushing can remove bacteria that could cause irritation of the eyes or even infection. To avoid those problems, make sure to use a mild cleaner, clear water rinse, and a clean lash brush to gently comb through your lashes and extensions.
  • Brushing is also an important part of your overall lash maintenance routine. When you brush each day, you can help to keep your lashes and extensions from becoming tangled, bent, or unkempt. That will ensure that you maintain their aesthetic appeal, while preventing them from suffering unnecessary damage or wear and tear.

Brushing Properly

Naturally, you need to know how to brush properly. These tips can help:

  • Always use a clean lash brush or mascara wand to avoid transferring bacteria to the eyes.
  • Brush from the middle of the extension to the end of the lash. Never start at the base, since that could result in the brush pulling the extension out.
  • For optimal results, brush the bottom of your extensions and the top of each lash. That’s the best way to ensure that you remove every offending particle of dust, oil, or debris.
  • Do this at least once a day. While it’s good to have an established routine and a set time for brushing, don’t be afraid to brush whenever you notice lashes going in the wrong direction or looking otherwise disheveled.

After all, when you get the best eyelash extensions in New York City, you expect them to last! Call us today to learn more, or to schedule your next lash extension appointment.

item.content:encoded:
Around the world, untold millions of women find themselves wishing that their eyelashes were somehow longer, fuller, or curled in a more pleasing way. These concerns are nothing new, of course, and have prompted a variety of different cosmetic trends throughout human history. It seems women – and some men – have always been searching for the perfect lash look. In recent years, that quest has focused on treatments like eyelash extensions, which offer women an opportunity to enhance their natural lashes. For some women, however, concerns about possible damage to their natural eyelashes have prevented them from experimenting with these lash treatments. So, what’s the verdict? Can extensions ruin your natural eyelashes?

A Mixed Assessment

There are some inherent difficulties when it comes to answering that type of question, largely because experiences have been so different for so many people. For millions of women, the application of lash extensions has resulted in the perfect, gorgeous lashes that they were looking for – without any side effects, discomfort, or real damage to those natural lashes. Meanwhile, other women have reported lash weakness and loss, or other similar complications. How can both types of result be true?

One thing is obvious: if most eyelash treatments cause no problems for the women who receive them, then it is clear that there is no inherent danger to the natural lash. That doesn’t explain the exceptions to that rule, however. Most experts believe that lash problems are in almost every instance the result of the type of application used to apply them. In other words, if you know someone whose natural lashes were damaged in any way by extensions, then the problem lies with the salon that did the application.

What the Best Salons Do Differently

It is important to recognize that poor lash extension jobs do not always indicate that the technician did a poor job. Sometimes, the problem is as simple as the type of adhesive used to affix each extension to that natural lash. Other times, the salon’s application technique is the problem. Even good technicians can have bad results when they’re working with inferior adhesives or are hamstrung by ineffective application techniques.

A truly professional salon avoids those problems by using only the best and safest adhesives in an application process designed to achieve the highest possible level of quality. Adhesives are applied with the utmost care to ensure that each extension is glued to only one lash, while avoiding direct contact with the skin. When done properly, there should never be any unexpected lash damage, including unnatural lash loss.
